Posts.Content: dmd2420 wrote: Hi to everyone who is reaching out to this site....  I was diagnosed with BC in May of this year....had 2 lumpectomies and still no clear margins. I have to have a mastectomy after my chemo is complete.    At present I am undergoing 4AC...4TH....(is that the right symbols?  Im new at this).  On Wednesday I will be undergoing my 2nd AC...the hair is going to come out...thats what I am being told.  I had..up until yesterday...long hair....cut it...short...like a bob (my wig style)....I'm dreading it...but at the same time...I will be relieved when its all gone.  Why is this hair thing such a big deal to me?  I am less afraid of taking off my breasts (yes...I'm opting for both...not just the one)....I would love to hear from anyone who can offer me support...I've found that woman who have been through this seem to "come out of the woodwork" and want to help other woman who are going through this disease.  I would be appreciative of any kind of information..  Thanks.....Denise Denise :) Dx 5/1/2009, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 3/14 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2009 10:27PM dmd2420 wrote: Hi Olive...I'm Denise....I was diagnosed in May of this year...and guess what...I cried...and cried...and cried some more.  I was at work at the time....left early and drove home with tears running down my face!  Then I would be okay...until I had to tell one of my kids or one of my friends, "I have cancer"...the tears started flowing again.  I'm okay with it now....I pretty much jumped into "what do I have to do to beat this" mode...I had 2 lumpectomies..my tumor was 1.5 cm...but a second mass (very tiny) was found with the second surgery.  I too, was like you....what should I do????  Now I have no choice...I am having a bilateral mastectomy when my chemo is done....I'm opting to take the second breast...no brainer for me...not going thru this again years to come.  I went to a support group when I found out about the impending mastectomy...it helped me immensely....I am no longer afraid....not to make light of it...but I'll end up with some pretty perky boobs in the long run....TALK to as many woman as you can that have been thru this...get a second opinion (I did and liked my second surgeon better than the first...she caught the second mass - Thank God!)  What I learned from my support group is "go with your gut"...you know us girls have it....listen to it....I'm so sorry that you are going through this...it sucks....no woman should have to...but be strong...I'm here for you.....I'd like to leave you with a quote....my sister-in-law gave me a card last weekend with this written on it:  "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us" (Ralph Waldo emerson)  Thinking of you....Denise :)
